Description: Body and foot sherd (mened from two fragments) of Attic black-glazed pottery cup-kantharos; wholly glazed; interior: stamped palmettes (once eight) within triple rouletting; exterior: ribbed lower wall and part of a X under the handle; scratched groove below with traces of miltos; inscription cut on underside of foot; from same vase as 1888,0601.240.a.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ8
Curator's comments: Φ08 in pencil on broken edge.
The piece is similar to mid-fourth century material from the Athenian Agora, Sparkes 1970a, nos. 673-4.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 68, no. 874, pl. XXII)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 694, no. 511)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 20)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1542)
